page.title: 06DERBY EVENING TELEGRAPH
page.content: This daily evening newspaper, which is distributed throughout Derbyshire, was first printed in{1879.}It has had two previous premises, but in 1980 new offices were built on the eastern edge of the inner city. The building was designed specifically to house a computer and a new{Â£3,000,000 printing {press,}which can make 1,000 copies per minute. The computer speeds up the process of setting up and laying out the pages. The daily circulation is 83,000, with an estimated{readership of 250,000. National and international news comes from the Press Association in London through five teleprinters. The D.E.T. has a London Office dealing with royalty and M.P.s. The paper is part of the Nortchliffe House group owned by{Associated {Newspapers,}who print the Daily Mail.
